poem:
"Reflections on Political Echoes"

Verdict's echo in the hollow halls,
A disappointment, laced in laments-
Son sculpted by judgment's fall.
A president's nod, acceptance spent;
The clock strikes the hour, bears the toll.
In the script of legalities, shadows are bent.
Yet, in each word, the truth unfolds-
Our human flaws, in time, are lent.
